page.title: 06THE WARPINGS.
page.content: There is a large track of land which extends into our area from the South, called{'THE WARPINGS'}. This name is derived from the old practice of{"warping"}the land. This was done by periodically opening the floodgates on the dykes and flooding the land. The floodwaters were then left for a length of weeks until the sediments had settled and thus enriched the land. The process physically{"warped" the land, hence the term{WARPING.}This process also encouraged peat to form. In the year{1801}an{Act of {Parliament}controlled the operation of {Warping}and placed certain obligations on the landowners rights to "warp". Warping has not been carried out in this area now for many years. But there are still people of more than 70 yrs. who remember skating on frozen floodwaters around the Warpings.
